title: How Pakistani Handlers Used A Popular Mobile Game To Target Rajasthan Man
content: Sohail was arrested in September last year, and the chargesheet filed by Rajasthan's Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) has revealed details not just about Sohail but also foreign-linked online networks that are targeting Indians,

title: "What A Shame": Omar Abdullah Slams House Arrests On Kashmir Martyrs' Day
content: Several ministers in the Omar Abdullah-led Jammu and Kashmir government, MLAs and top leaders of the ruling party and the Opposition were put under house arrest or detained to prevent them from observing Kashmir Martyrs' Day today.

title: Migrant Auto Driver Beaten In Maharashtra Days After "Hindi Bolunga" Remark
content: A migrant auto-rickshaw driver in Maharashtra's Palghar district was assaulted in full public view by supporters of the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena (UBT) and Raj Thackeray's Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) after a prior confrontation over Marathi

title: "Mitti, Kajal, Darshan": Chhangur Baba's Code Words For Conversion "Project"
content: Project, mitti palatna, kajal lagana and darshan - these were the code words Jamaluddin alias Chhangur Baba used at various stages to convert one's faith as he lured several people.

title: India Reverses Rule, Eases Sulphur Emission Rules For Coal Power Plants
content: India has reversed a decade-old mandate to install $30 billion worth of clean-air equipment, easing sulphur emission rules for most coal-fired power plants, a government order said.

title: "Elon, His Teams Are...": Indian-Origin Techie Quits xAI To Join OpenAI
content: The Indian-origin head of infrastructure engineering at Elon Musk's artificial intelligence company xAI has resigned to join OpenAI.

title: "People Living In Fear": Ex Minister's Friendly Fire Over Bihar Murders
content: A day after BJP ally Chirag Paswan targeted the Nitish Kumar government over the string of murders in Bihar, the JDU-BJP ruling alliance has drawn friendly fire from senior BJP leader and former Union Minister Ram Kripal Yadav.

title: "Just Release Epstein Files": Elon Musk Doubles Down After Trump Post
content: Billionaire Elon Musk asked his former ally and US President, Donald Trump, to just release the case files related to sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, as promised.

title: 5 Injured In Delhi Hit-And-Run, Drunk Audi Driver Runs Over Migrant Workers
content: A drunk driver of an Audi car allegedly ran over five people, including two couples and an eight-year-old girl, injuring them while they were sleeping on a footpath near Shiva Camp in southwest Delhi's Vasant Vihar area, an official said on Saturday.

title: Report Points To "Bad Decisions" That Led To Trump Assassination Bid
content: The Secret Service"failed to implement security measures" that could have prevented the July 13, 2024, assassination attempt on US President Donald Trump, according to a newly released report by the Government Accountability Office (GAO).

title: Iran's President Was Injured In Israel's Nasrallah-Style Assassination Plot: Report
content: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian was lightly injured in an Israeli airstrike on June 16, Iranian Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC)-affiliated Fars News Agency reported on Sunday.

title: Bihar Survey Finds Many Voters From Nepal, Bangladesh, Myanmar: Sources
content: The door-to-door survey part of the Election Commission's Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of Bihar's voter lists has found that many people originally from Nepal, Bangladesh and Myanmar are currently living in the poll-bound state, sources said

title: Mumbai Blasts Lawyer, Ex Foreign Secretary Among 4 To Get Rajya Sabha Pass
content: Top lawyer Ujjwal Nikam and former Foreign Secretary Harsh Vardhan Shringla are among the four people President Droupadi Murmu has nominated to the Rajya Sabha.

title: "If Anything Happens...": Why Indore Man Fitted A Huge Camera On Helmet
content: The man alleges that he and his family have been harassed and threatened with death by their neighbours over a property dispute.

title: Pakistan's Nuclear Backtrack Weeks After "Full Spectrum" Threat To India
content: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has said that the country's nuclear programme is intended strictly for "peaceful purposes and self-defence", drawing a contrast to earlier statements by senior Pakistani officials.

title: BJP Leader Shot Dead In Patna, Week After Businessman Gopal Khemka's Murder
content: Less than 10 days after prominent businessman Gopal Khemka was shot dead outside his Patna home, the Bihar capital has reported another chilling murder, this time of a BJP leader

title: RBI To Phase Out Rs 500 Notes By 2026? Here Is A Fact Check
content: The Press Information Bureau's Fact Check clarified that the RBI has issued no such directive and that Rs 500 notes remain legal tender.

title: How An Indian Businessman Outsmarted The Nazis, Rescued 5 Jewish Families
content: Long before the world came to know the story of Schindler's List, a businessman from Punjab was risking everything to quietly rescue Jewish families from the grip of Nazi persecution.

title: Myanmar Nationals Who Sought Refuge In Mizoram Return Home
content: Around 2,500 Myanmar nationals, who had sought refuge in Mizoram following violent clashes between the Chinland Defence Force-Hualngoram (CDF-Hualngoram) and the Chin National Defence Force (CNDF) on July 5, began returning to their country.

title: Odisha To Copyright Jagannath Temple Rituals
content: The Odisha government has started working on securing copyright for the rituals of Lord Jagannath temple in Puri to protect its traditional cultural expressions, Gajapati Maharaja Dibyasingha Deb, the titular king of the pilgrim town, said.

title: Sinner vs. Alcaraz: Who will win the Wimbledon title?
content: Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner will face off for the second time in a major final, at Wimbledon on Sunday. Our experts make predictions.

title: Browns' Judkins facing domestic violence charge
content: Cleveland Browns rookie running back Quinshon Judkins was arrested on a domestic violence and battery charge in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, on Saturday, according to the Fort Lauderdale Police Department and Broward County arrest records.

title: Sources: Anthony bought out, looks to join Bucks
content: Cole Anthony agreed to a contract buyout with the Memphis Grizzlies, and the 25-year-old guard plans to sign with the Milwaukee Bucks after he clears waivers, sources told ESPN on Saturday night.

title: Stevenson keeps belt with decision win vs. Zepeda
content: Shakur Stevenson couldn't score a knockout blow against William Zepeda but put together a boxing clinic to retain his WBC lightweight title with a unanimous decision Saturday night in Queens, N.Y.

title: Messi extends historic streak with 2 more goals
content: Lionel Messi extended his MLS-record streak of multigoal games as he scored twice in Inter Miami's win over Nashville.

title: Sharpe, 3-time Pro Bowl LT for Cardinals, dies
content: Longtime Cardinals left tackle Luis Sharpe, a three-time Pro Bowler who spent his entire 13-year NFL career with the franchise, has died at age 65.

title: Harper's Spurs top Flagg's Mavs at summer league
content: The top two choices in the NBA draft, Cooper Flagg and Dylan Harper, faced off Saturday in the NBA summer league, and flashed an enticing view of what might be on the horizon next season during the San Antonio Spurs' 76-69 win over the Dallas Mavericks.

title: Roberts, Murphy back Misiorowski ASG selection
content: The addition of Milwaukee Brewers pitcher Jacob Misiorowski to the NL All-Star team drew mixed reactions around baseball, but on Saturday, NL manager Dave Roberts supported the selection, adding the rookie should bring "some more excitement" to the game.

title: FIFA, players agree to mandatory rest periods
content: Player unions secured a victory in their battle for mandatory rest periods after a meeting in New York with FIFA president Gianni Infantino.

title: ðŸ›‘ Why LeBron, Lakers are stuck in limbo
content: For months, publicly and privately, the Lakers have been signaling their desire to begin the Luka Doncic era in Los Angeles, even if it meant ending the LeBron James one.

title: MLB mock draft 3.0: Kiley McDaniel predicts the first two rounds
content: The MLB draft is Sunday! And this year, the drama starts with the Washington Nationals at the No. 1 pick.

title: Transfer rumors, news: USMNT's Pulisic wanted by Ronaldo's Al Nassr
content: Al Nassr are looking at a summer move for AC Milan's United States star Christian Pulisic. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Tillman to Leverkusen: Can USMNT star fill void left by Wirtz?
content: Malik Tillman is coming off a career year and Bayer Leverkusen are in transition. Is this a perfect match?

title: How Iga Swiatek defied all expectations to win her first Wimbledon title
content: After an early exit at her favorite Slam last month, Swiatek rebounded on her worst surface to take the Wimbledon title.

title: The unstoppable power of Jim Abbott's legacy
content: Abbott, who pitched in the majors with one hand, remains a beacon for families with unique struggles.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Sweden demolish Germany, Poland make history
content: Sweden topped Group C with a commanding win over Germany. Here's everything you need to know about Euro 2025 action.

title: USMNT star Tillman joins Leverkusen from PSV
content: United States men's national team midfielder Malik Tillman has completed a move to Bayer Leverkusen, the club announced Saturday.

title: Infantino: Covered stadiums to be used at '26 WC
content: FIFA President Gianni Infantino said stadiums with roofs will be used to ease concerns over severe weather at the 2026 Men's World Cup.

title: Sweden inflict Germany's biggest-ever Euros loss
content: Sweden handed Germany their biggest-ever defeat at a women's European Championship, with a 4-1 win to secure top spot in Group C.

title: Not done yet: Cazorla, 40, inks new Oviedo deal
content: Santi Cazorla will be back in LaLiga next season after signing a new contract with newly promoted Real Oviedo.

title: LaLiga boss rejects Madrid plea to extend break
content: LaLiga president Javier Tebas rejected Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois' plea to postpone the team's 2025-26 league opener to give players time to rest following the Club World Cup.

title: Louis van Gaal 'no longer bothered by cancer'
content: Louis van Gaal has said he is "no longer bothered by cancer" and is keen for a return to the higher levels of the game.

title: How Chelsea, PSG compare; who will win?
content: One of Chelsea or PSG will win the first expanded Club World Cup on Sunday, so how do they match up ahead of the final?

title: Who are the NFL's best interior offensive linemen? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: Execs, coaches and scouts from around the NFL ranked their top 10 interior offensive linemen in our annual summer series.

title: Why the NFLPA mess should matter to football fans
content: It behooves the competitive balance of the NFL to have strong ownership and strong labor, Wetzel writes.

title: How every five-star college football recruit fits at his new school
content: There are 23 five-stars in the Class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

title: AI171 crash: At what stage did engines lose thrust? Pilots flag ambiguities; question reportâ€™s intent
content: Pilots express concerns and skepticism regarding the AAIB report on the AI-171 incident, questioning the timing of engine shutdowns and the failure of the emergency locator transmitter. They highlight ambiguities in the report, the lack of transparency in the investigation, and the exclusion of experienced pilots from the investigation team.

title: Bloodstained car, no trace of owner: Intel cop missing for 4 days; search operation on
content: A Punjab Police constable from the state intelligence department, Satinder Singh, has been missing since Tuesday night, prompting a large-scale search operation. His car was found near Bhanra village in Patiala, bearing bloodstains, raising concerns about his safety.

title: Bihar SIR: Nepalese, Bangladeshis found in voter list; names to be excluded from final list
content: Election Commission officials in Bihar have identified numerous individuals from Nepal, Bangladesh, and Myanmar during voter list revisions. This verification process aims to exclude illegal migrants from the electoral roll, with citizenship status checks beginning in August.

title: 'Finger pointing and ... ': KP on Shubman Gill-Zak Crawley drama at Lord's
content: Tensions flared during the final moments of Day 3 in the India-England Test at Lord's, with Jasprit Bumrah and Zak Crawley at the center of a heated exchange. Shubman Gill and other Indian players engaged in verbal sparring with Crawley, prompting intervention from Ben Duckett. Kevin Pietersen supported the aggression, adding spice to the already intense series.

title: Top engineer quits Elon Muskâ€™s AI firm: Joins OpenAI; says â€˜Jensen Huang was rightâ€¦â€™
content: Uday Ruddarraju, xAI's head of infrastructure engineering, has resigned after a year, having been instrumental in building the Colossus supercomputer and training Grok 3. He expressed gratitude to Elon Musk and the xAI team for the experience. Shortly after his departure, Ruddarraju announced he is joining OpenAI, with OpenAI President Greg Brockman welcoming him and other engineers.

title: Amarnath Yatra: Three buses collide in Kulgam; 10 pilgrims injured
content: A convoy of buses carrying Amarnath Yatra pilgrims met with an accident in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district. The incident occurred on Sunday. At least ten pilgrims sustained injuries. They were immediately shifted to a nearby hospital. The injured are now in stable condition. Damaged buses were replaced and the remaining yatris resumed their journey.

title: â€˜She pushed me into riverâ€™: Murder bid? Man accuses wife after dramatic rescue in Karnataka
content: A man was rescued from the Krishna River near Garjapur after allegedly being pushed by his wife. Sooraj claimed Neethu pushed him while taking photos on a bridge. High water levels swept him away, but locals rescued him using ropes in a two-hour operation. Neethu denied the accusations, and the couple left together without filing a complaint.

title: 'Not for aggression': Pak PM Sharif plays it down; denies nuclear escalation during Op Sindoor
content: Amidst escalating tensions, Pakistan's PM Shehbaz Sharif has dismissed nuclear exchange possibilities with India, asserting their nuclear program is for peace and defense. This follows alleged Pakistani "nuclear blackmails," which India vowed to counter bilaterally. Tensions rose further after India suspended the Indus Waters Treaty, prompting Pakistan to threaten retaliation.

title: Government on Chinese engineers leaving Indian iPhone factories: â€˜Apple has alternativesâ€¦â€™
content: The Indian government is closely watching the departure of Chinese engineers from Foxconn, a major iPhone supplier, but believes Apple has solutions to maintain production. Despite concerns about potential disruptions to iPhone 17 production, Apple is increasing iPhone production in India, aiming for 60 million units this year, with eased component sourcing from China and government support through visa facilitation.

title: Missed call to murder: Lover kills woman over marriage threat in UP
content: A fatal love affair, sparked by a missed call, ended in murder in Balrampur. Ragini, 20, was found dead, and her lover, Vinod Kumar, confessed to strangling her. He claimed she threatened him with rape charges for refusing marriage after he discovered she was already married.

title: Stock market this week: Key factors expected to influence D-Street
content: Indian markets concluded the week with losses exceeding 1%, influenced by global tariff uncertainties and a tepid start to Q1 earnings. The Nifty50 breached its 20-day EMA, signaling potential consolidation. Investors will closely monitor upcoming Q1 earnings from major companies and key inflation data from India and the US for future direction.

title: Why X CEO Linda Yaccarino and 14 other executives may have just quit
content: Linda Yaccarino resigned as CEO of X amidst turmoil in Elon Musk's empire, marked by high-profile departures across Tesla, SpaceX, and X. Fourteen senior leaders have exited in the past year, citing disagreements over strategy, political focus, and internal tensions. The departures raise concerns about Musk's ability to retain talent as his ventures intertwine with political ambitions.

title: Another Bihar shocker: BJP leader shot dead; week after bizman Gopal Khemkaâ€™s murder
content: In Bihar's Sheikhpura district, BJP leader Surendra Kewat was fatally shot by unidentified assailants, adding to the escalating concerns over law and order. This incident occurred shortly after the murder of businessman Gopal Khemka in Patna. Tejashwi Yadav, an RJD leader, criticized the NDA government's handling of the situation following the recent violence.

title: Language row: Auto driver slapped by Sena (UBT) workers over â€˜anti-Marathiâ€™ remark
content: A video showing Shiv Sena (UBT) workers assaulting an auto-rickshaw driver in Palghar for allegedly insulting the Marathi language and icons has gone viral. The driver was forced to apologize publicly. The incident follows a similar action by MNS workers against a food stall owner for not speaking Marathi, highlighting tensions over language use in Maharashtra.

title: Epstein case: Musk targets Trump again; asks US president to 'release the files as promised'
content: Elon Musk, the estranged ally of Donald Trump, has publicly urged the former president to release the "Epstein Files," following Trump's Truth Social post on the matter. Musk's demand comes after the DOJ and FBI concluded their investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death, denying any murder or the existence of a client list.

title: 'Friendship is done': Swift unlikely to forgive Blake Lively after betrayal
content: Taylor Swift and Blake Lively's friendship faces trouble. Sources say they are not in contact. This follows Lively's connection to Justin Baldoni's legal issues. Lively's image suffered, straining the bond. Swift is now focused on Travis Kelce. Lively seeks new high-profile connections. The friendship may be over. Both are moving on with their careers and relationships.

title: Gisele BÃ¼ndchenâ€™s tearful interview: Healing after Tom Brady divorce
content: Gisele Bundchen spoke about her divorce from Tom Brady in March 2024. She described it as the death of her dream. Bundchen dismissed media claims that Brady's return to football caused the split. She expressed continued support for Brady's happiness and success. Bundchen is focusing on her own truth and has grown close to Joaquim Valente.

title: WWE Saturday nightâ€™s: Gunther beats Goldberg, LA Knight defeats Seth Rollins
content: Saturday Night's Main Event witnessed thrilling encounters, including Randy Orton's victory over Drew McIntyre aided by Jelly Roll's ringside presence. Solo Sikoa retained his title amidst controversy, while LA Knight triumphed over an injured Seth Rollins. Gunther retained the WWE World Title against Goldberg in a dramatic match, targeting Goldberg's knee and involving his son, Gage.

title: â€˜Sorry maâ€™: Vijay protests DMK-era lock-up deaths; demands aid for all victimsâ€™ families
content: Actor Vijay, leader of TVK, protested against lock-up deaths during the DMK's governance in Tamil Nadu. The protest, held in Chennai, saw slogans raised against the government. Vijay demanded an apology and compensation for the families of the victims. He criticized Chief Minister M K Stalin's handling of the issue. Vijay assured support to the victim's families.

title: Delhi-Mumbai Expressway crash: 4 dead, 10 injured as minibus hits truck
content: A tragic collision on the Delhi-Mumbai Expressway in Kota district resulted in the deaths of four family members from Karoli, Rajasthan, including a mother, her two sons, and her son-in-law. The traveller they were in rammed into a truck, also injuring ten others.

title: Tennis player murder: Radhikaâ€™s father a control freak, says friend; killed because of 'male ego'?
content: Radhika Yadav, a 25-year-old tennis player, was tragically murdered by her father, Deepak, who felt threatened by her independence. Her best friend, Himanshika Singh, revealed that Radhika felt suffocated by her father's controlling behavior and constant criticism.

title: Aaron Rodgers at war, clash with Steelers coaches called 'a mistake'
content: Hall of Famer Jerome Bettis is concerned about the Pittsburgh Steelers' potential identity shift after acquiring Aaron Rodgers and DK Metcalf. Bettis emphasizes the importance of maintaining a run-first approach, despite Rodgers' preference for a pass-heavy offense. The clash between Rodgers' style and offensive coordinator Arthur Smith's ground-focused scheme raises questions about the team's future success.

title: 'I didn't cheat': IAS officer slaps student repeatedly during exam in MP; watch
content: A video surfaced showing Bhind DM Sanjeev Srivastava slapping a student during a BSc exam at Deendayal Dangraulia Mahavidyalaya. Srivastava claims the student was involved in mass cheating, sending his paper out for answers. He has requested Jiwaji University to take action against the college, which is linked to a political figure.

title: Cricket: Suryakumar Yadav hilariously trolls Rohit Sharma - Watch
content: Rohit Sharma's forgetful nature is a well-known trait in the cricketing world, often leading to humorous situations. Teammates like Suryakumar Yadav have shared anecdotes about Rohit misplacing items such as his phone, wallet, and iPad. This forgetfulness has become a subject of light-hearted banter among players and fans alike, adding to his endearing persona.

title: 'Fell from auto': Woman claims rape on top B-school campus; her father says 'nothing happened'
content: A 24-year-old psychologist accused a management student in Kolkata of rape, leading to his arrest. However, in a surprising turn, the woman's father later claimed that "nothing had happened," alleging police coercion. The accused, Paramanand Toppannawar, was remanded in police custody for seven days. The institute is cooperating with the investigation, according to a press statement.

title: 'Ring, bangles, necklace': Sonam's brother returns jewellery; 2 co-accused granted bail
content: Govind Raghuwanshi, brother of murder accused Sonam, returned jewellery worth Rs 16 lakh to Raja's family. The jewellery was given to Sonam during her wedding. Govind handed over the ornaments through Rajendra Nagar police station. He stated that he had no claim over them. Sonam's family refused to take back any gifts they had given to Raja.

title: DU curriculum revamp sparks transparency concerns amid FYUP rollout
content: Delhi University has approved curriculum changes amid concerns over academic transparency, especially regarding the removal of certain syllabus content. The university is preparing to introduce the fourth year under the National Education Policy 2020, with over 60 per cent of students expected to enrol. Infrastructure upgrades worth Rs 1,912 crore and digital improvements have been sanctioned. Staffing plans include regular faculty handling senior courses, while entrepreneurship and scholarship initiatives are also underway, as reported by the PTI.

title: Kash Patel breaks silence amid resignation buzz; addresses 'conspiracy theories'
content: FBI Director Kash Patel refuted rumors of his resignation amid reports of frustration over the Justice Department's handling of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. Patel affirmed his commitment to serving the President, dismissing conspiracy theories surrounding the case. A joint FBI and Justice Department memo addressed claims of a client list and blackmail, stating no credible evidence was found to support them.

title: Jaideep Ahlawat reveals he used to have 40 rotis, 1.5litres of milk everyday
content: Jaideep Ahlawat, known for his diverse roles, recently shared insights into his food habits and weight management. Growing up in rural Haryana, he maintained a healthy weight despite consuming large quantities of food due to an active lifestyle.

title: UK shifts to eVisas from July 15: Don't fly without ticking off this student checklist
content: From July 15, 2025, the UK will issue all new visas as eVisasâ€”secure digital records linked to passportsâ€”replacing physical visa stickers. This change affects all international students, who must now register with UKVI, maintain updated passport details, and carry visa decision letters when travelling. The digital system will be used for identity verification by universities, landlords, and employers. Students must complete a checklist to ensure compliance and avoid travel or registration issues.

title: PREVIEW | Wimbledon 2025: Jannik Sinner takes on Carlos Alcaraz in final
content: Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz are set for a Wimbledon final showdown, their second Major final clash. Despite Sinner's recent loss to Alcaraz at Roland Garros, he dismisses its impact on the upcoming match. Alcaraz acknowledges Sinner's ability to learn from defeats.

title: 'My office they can take, but my home': SRK on why Mannat is his heart
content: For Shah Rukh Khan, Mannat is more than a house. It is a symbol of family, love, and legacy. He bought it to provide stability for his children. He wants Mannat to remain in his family for generations. It is a safe haven for his wife and children. The home blends faith and tradition.

title: Trade war: Trump threatens 20%â€“50% tariff on 23 nations - check full list
content: Donald Trump has threatened major trade partners with new import tariffs, ranging from 20% to 50%, demanding individual trade deals by August 1. The EU and Mexico have condemned the proposed tariffs as unfair, while expressing willingness to negotiate. Trump cites trade deficits and fentanyl concerns as justification, despite data showing most fentanyl enters the US from Mexico.

title: Gillâ€™s Lordâ€™s outburst sparks meme fest comparing him to Kohli
content: Tensions flared between England and India at Lord's on Day 3, sparked by Zak Crawley's time-wasting tactics that frustrated Shubman Gill and the Indian team. KL Rahul's magnificent century, along with valuable contributions from Ravindra Jadeja and Rishabh Pant, enabled India to match England's first-innings score of 387, setting the stage for a thrilling contest.

title: Age just a number: Senior citizens crack NEET; apply for MBBS seats in Tamil Nadu
content: In Tamil Nadu, several older individuals, including lawyers and other professionals, have applied for MBBS admissions after clearing NEET 2025. While the NMC has no age restrictions, officials are grappling with document discrepancies and debating whether a special quota for government school students should extend to older graduates.

title: Audi runs over 5 sleeping on footpath in Delhi; 8-year-old among injured; driver held
content: In a tragic incident in Delhi's Vasant Vihar, an Audi ran over five people sleeping on a footpath near a petrol pump, resulting in critical injuries. The victims, identified as Ladhi, Bimla, Sabami, Narayani, and Ramchander, were immediately rushed to the hospital. Police have apprehended the driver, Utsav Shekhar, a resident of Dwarka, and initiated legal proceedings.

title: Bigg Boss Fame Abdu Rozik Detained in Dubai Over Alleged Theft Charges, Reports
content: Abdu Rozik, the Tajikistani singer and reality TV star, was reportedly detained at Dubai International Airport on alleged theft charges but later released, according to his management. His team refuted arrest reports and hinted at further details regarding the incident. Rozik, a Dubai resident with a UAE Golden Visa, has faced controversies before, including a money laundering probe in 2023.

title: 'Came for meditation': Russian woman with expired visa found in cave with kids
content: In Gokarna, police rescued a Russian woman, Nina Kutina, and her two young daughters from a cave near Ramateertha Falls. Nina's visa expired in 2017, though her children were born in India. Authorities were surprised to find them in such a remote, dangerous area. Nina claimed she came to Karnataka for meditation and worshipped an idol of Lord Rama.

title: 'Anti-social elements': JMM's X account 'hacked'; Hemant Soren reacts
content: Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren reported that the official X account of his party, Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM), was hacked by anti-social elements. Soren has directed the Jharkhand Police to investigate the matter immediately and urged X to take notice of the security breach.

title: PREVIEW | CWC Final: Chelsea and PSG to battle it out for top prize
content: Paris Saint-Germain and Chelsea are set to face off in the Club World Cup final. With star power on both sides and plenty at stake, Sundayâ€™s clash promises fireworks in every department.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Out nahin hona hain' - Pant prods himself to battle through pain
content: Despite a painful blow to his left index finger, Rishabh Pant displayed remarkable resilience during India's innings at Lord's. He battled through the pain, scoring a crucial 74 runs. Pant's self-motivation and constant self-talk, a practice instilled by his coach Tarak Sinha, helped him navigate the discomfort and contribute significantly to India's performance on Day Three.

title: Exclusive| 'Iâ€™ll qualify, donâ€™t worry': Kujur on making it to World C'ships
content: Animesh Kujur, despite a fourth-place finish at the Monaco Diamond League, remains optimistic about qualifying for the World Championships in Tokyo. He aims to shave 0.16 seconds off his personal best to meet the 20.16-second qualification time. Coach Owen Martins believes it's achievable with the right conditions, highlighting Kujur's significant progress and the Odisha government's support in providing international exposure.

title: Tamil Nadu: Diesel tanker on freight train goes up in flames near Thiruvallur; watch
content: A major disruption hit the Chennaiâ€“Arakkonam train route early Sunday as a crude oil tanker on a freight train caught fire near Thiruvallur. The train, carrying 45 tankers from Ennore to Mumbai, experienced the incident around 5 am. Rail traffic was halted, causing delays and diversions. No injuries have been reported, and an investigation into the fire's cause is underway.

title: Odisha horror: Student sets self ablaze after HoD's sexual harassment; in critical condition
content: A 20-year-old college student in Balasore, Odisha, suffered critical burn injuries after allegedly setting herself on fire due to prolonged sexual harassment by a teacher. A fellow student was also injured while attempting to rescue her.

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Where LSU fits after landing Lamar Brown
content: no. 1 overall prospect Lamar Brown commits to play for the LSU Tigers . 15 of the teams in the current top 25 secured at least one ESPN 300 commitment . Alabama is on the rise by adding multiple four-star (or better) prospects .

title: Katie Taylor fought the right fight at the right time against Amanda Serrano
content: women's boxing may not have the stage it had on Netflix in front of millions of viewers . she fought serrano's fight for the first 20 rounds of their trilogy . her coach and promoter advised her the first two times to not make the fights more difficult .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Patrick Mahomes in Round 11? WRs, RBs prioritized in 8-team mock draft
content: some fantasy football mock drafts are for leagues with 10 or 12 teams . fewer starting slots than in larger leagues, there are notable differences in draft approach . most obvious comes at quarterback, where only five were selected in the first 10 rounds .

title: Who dropped out of the top 10? Players eyeing a bounce-back at TE, RB and Edge
content: sportsmail's survey of the top 10 players at every position is unveiled . we'll collect those names here as the top-10 for each position is revealed . more than 70 voters submitted a ballot on at least one position, and in many cases all positions .

title: Shakur Stevenson showed that the fight in him is second to none
content: Shakur Stevenson beats William Zepeda to retain his WBC lightweight title . he was promoted to the co-main event of Ring Magazine 3 by Turki Alalshikh . the chairman of Saudi Arabia's general entertainment authority was elevated to the main event .

title: The 30 players you need to pay attention to in summer league, from Atlanta to Washington
content: the 11-day tournament begins Thursday and runs through July 20 . the event will be headlined by the fresh faces of the 2025 draft class . top 2025 picks Cooper Flagg, Dylan Harper and VJ Edgecombe will all be in action .

title: Watch: NRIs perform 'Ganga Aarti' on Canadian riverbank; sparks mixed response
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. title: Nasrallah-style op: Israel plotted to kill Iranâ€™s President Pezeshkian? report claims
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: Election Commission always a 'puppet' in hands of Modi government: Kapil Sibal

title: 5 held for thrashing Dalit teen, hurling casteist abuses in U.P.â€™s Muzaffarnagar

title: Dharmasthala burial case: Dakshina Kannada police to ascertain stand of complainant, advocates on changing investigating officer or handing over case to SIT
content: Dharmasthala police also booked a case against YouTuber M.D. Sameer on July 11 for providing false and fictitious information on the burial case to the public through his channel

title: IIM-Calcutta â€˜rapeâ€™: Womanâ€™s father claims no such incident took place

title: Amid reports of Jayant Patilâ€™s resignation, NCP (SP) to hold meet on July 15

title: ULFA(I) claims drone attacks on its camps along Myanmar border, Indian Army denies any involvement
content: The ULFA(I), in a press statement, said the attacks were carried out with drones in the early hours at several mobile camps

title: Auto-rickshaw driver thrashed by Sena (UBT) workers over 'anti-Marathi' remarks; video goes viral
content: The auto-rickshaw driver, a migrant residing in the Virar area of Palghar, had allegedly made derogatory remarks against the Marathi language, Maharashtra and Marathi icons

title: My brother had confessed to killing his daughter: Slain tennis player Radhika Yadav's uncle
content: Talking to reporters in Gurugram, Vijay Yadav, the elder brother of Deepak Yadav, also categorically denied that Radhika Yadav had a tennis academy

title: Raj, Uddhav alliance needed to give new direction to Maharashtra: Sanjay Raut

title: Five militants arrested in Manipur

title: TVK chief Vijay leads protest against custodial deaths in Tamil Nadu

title: Goa man on run after submitting fake documents for passport nabbed in Chennai
content: The police launched a search using both technical and human intelligence and traced Choure to Chennai, an official said

title: Bihar SIR: People from Nepal, Bangladesh, Myanmar found during drive; will not be included in final voter list, says Election Commission
content: The Bihar SIR began on June 25 and the last date for submitting Enumeration Forms given by Booth Level Officers to voters is July 25, following which a draft list would be brought out on August 1

title: Himachal govt announces â‚¹2 crore each for constituencies severely affected by rains
content: So far, since the onset of monsoon on June 20 till July 11, Himachal Pradesh has suffered losses of â‚¹751 crore

content: The family from Kabul moved to Thiruvananthapuram in 2021 when Mr. Shafiq Rahimi joined the Department of Economics of the University of Kerala as a Research Scholar in Economics

title: Muslims doctors in nine medical colleges in Bengal stands at 6.6%; RTI enquiries reveal
content: Murshidabad Medical College and Hospital recorded highest number of Muslim doctors at 19.56%  and Puruliaâ€™s Deben Mahato Hospital and Medical College recorded lowest % Muslim doctors at 1.82%. Muslim population in West Bengal stands at 27.01 %

content: The President of India nominates 12 persons as her nominees to the Rajya Sabha, four seats are currently vacant.

title: Amarnath Yatra: Fresh batch of over 7,000 pilgrims leave from Jammu base camp

title: The peopling of the Indian subcontinent
content: According to the 2011 Census, inter-caste marriages were about 6% and inter-faith ones about 1%. It is likely these numbers will have risen significantly when the forthcoming 2027 Census offers the numbers

title: Foreign Medical Graduates get relief as A.P. High Court asks APMC to issue PR to appellant

title: How is Mizoram handling the refugee crisis?

title: What is the state of inequality in India?

title: The preliminary report on the AI 171 crash is notably brief and lacking in technical transparency, says aviation expert
